idinfo.citation:
Indiana Geological Survey H. H. Gray (Data compiler) Chris Dintaman (GIS compiler) 20020328
UNCONSOL_TH_MM37_IN: Thickness Ranges of Unconsolidated Deposits in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:500,000, Polygon Shapefile)
Map
Bloomington, Indiana Indiana Geological Survey
IGS Inventory Bar Code Number 11000048
This shapefile was derived and modified from a preexisting published paper map: Gray, H. H., 1983. Map of Indiana showing thickness of unconsolidated deposits. Miscellaneous Map 37, Indiana Geological Survey. http://igs.indiana.edu/arcims/statewide/download.html

descript.abstract: UNCONSOL_TH_MM37_IN is a polygon shapefile showing thickness ranges of unconsolidated deposits (everything above the bedrock) in Indiana. The thickness ranges consist of 50-foot increments (0 to 50, 50 to 100, etc.).
descript.purpose: UNCONSOL_TH_MM37_IN was created to provide a digital shapefile showing thickness of unconsolidated sediments in Indiana, as shown on a preexisting published paper map, (Gray, H. H., 1983. Map of Indiana showing thickness of unconsolidated deposits. Miscellaneous Map 37, Indiana Geological Survey).

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format Approximately 0.7 Mb

attracc.attraccr: The following notes appear on the published map: "An estimated 60,000 datum points were used in construction of this map. Data include principally well records and seismic-refraction test records on file at the Indiana Dept. of Natural Resources, Division of Water and Division of Geological Survey, supplemented by data from a variety of other sources. Grant, Marion, and Vigo Counties are from Geological Survey reports published or in preparation. Data compilation by Particia G. Davis and Michele A. Wright. Drafted by Roger L. Purcell." Thickness values assigned to the digital shapefile are based on the published map. Values of attributes were visually inspected and compared with values appearing on the published source map.

dataqual.logic: ArcInfo polygon topology is present. Checks for dangling nodes, sliver polygons etc. were performed by IGS staff in ESRI ArcInfo (v 8.1).
dataqual.complete: The digital shapefile was derived without significant modification from a preexisting published paper map and is assumed to embody the same definitions and generalizations as were used in the creation of the published paper map. Note from the published map: "'unconsolidated deposits' does not include artificial fill, strip-mined spoil, etc. Intermediate contours are omitted in congested areas." The contours omitted on the published paper map have been added by interpolation to the digital shapefile, by an IGS geologist.

horizpa.horizpar: No records exist regarding the horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing the shapefile were derived from the same Mylar separate (1:500,000 scale) as the thickness polygons. The following note appears on the published source map: "Base modified from U.S. Geological Survey Base Map of Indiana, 1973 edition." During georeferencing, ArcInfo reported an rms error of 117.16 meters.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy of the published paper source map is unknown. Vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of UNCONSOL_TH_MM37_IN. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.title: Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Unconsolidated Deposits
citeinfo.othercit: The shapefile linework was derived from a Mylar separate that was used in the preparation of a published paper map: Gray, H.H., 1983. Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Unconsolidated Deposits. Miscellaneous Map 37, Indiana Geological Survey.

srcinfo.srccontr: The lines of this shapefile were derived by vectorizing the lines of the Mylar separate.

citeinfo.title: Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Unconsolidated Deposits
citeinfo.othercit: The shapefile attributes were derived from a published paper map: Gray, H.H., 1983. Map of Indiana Showing Thickness of Unconsolidated Deposits. Miscellaneous Map 37, Indiana Geological Survey.

srcinfo.srccontr: The attributes of this shapefile were derived by comparison with the attributes of the source paper map and the lines of the source Mylar separate.

procstep.procdesc: The Mylar separate that had been used in the publication of Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) Miscellaneous Map 37 was acquired from the IGS Graphics and Cartography section. The Mylar separate was then scanned by personnel of the IGS using a black-and-white wide-bed scanner to a digital raster image. This raster image was converted to an ESRI ArcInfo grid using the command IMAGEGRID. The grid was then vectorized in the ESRI ArcInfo ArcTools environment to produce a coverage of lines representing the unconsolidated thicknesses. This data was then georeferenced to UTM Zone 16, NAD 83. The lines were then appended to the IGS State boundary base map (1:100,000 source scale). Dangling nodes were then removed by extending "short" lines and deleting "long" overhanging lines. The resulting coverage was cleaned to build polygon topology. The polygons were then attributed with a minimum and maximum thickness value based on the data contained in the paper source map (IGS Misc. Map 37).
procstep.srcused: IGS MM37 (paper map and Mylar separate)

procstep.procdesc: This coverage was then clipped to another coverage, INCLP83, containing the area within the 92 county boundaries for the state of Indiana, which was compiled at a scale of 1:24,000. Since UNCONSOL_TH_MM37 and INCLP83 boundaries did not coincide perfectly with one another, some polygons along the state boundary were either slightly truncated or slightly extended to the new boundary. In every case, the modifications were minor. The resulting coverage was converted to a shapefile named "UNCONSOL_TH_MM37_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: the minimum thickness value of a polygon
the maximum thickness value of a polygon

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
